root_causes: Incorrect handling of the DK flag: script accepts special codes 97/98/99 for A4DKx2 but the expected logic indicates only code 99 should be treated as the DK flag.
Missing validation for open-text items: the expected validation code calls CheckMultiOpenD1() and CheckOpenLengthMultiOE(...), which are not represented in the SPSS logic.
instructions: Restrict the DK acceptance to code 99 only. Replace any(A4DKx2,97,98,99) with any(A4DKx2,99) in the validation selection logic.

Add the open-text validations required by the specification: when the multi response is present (f('A4x2').toBoolean()), run the equivalent checks for CheckMultiOpenD1() and CheckOpenLengthMultiOE(CurrentForm(),5,0,"chars"). If those exact functions cannot be called from SPSS, implement checks that enforce presence/format and minimum length rules for the open-text follow-ups.
Ensure the selection logic continues to require at least one of the A4x2 sub-items selected OR A4DKx2==99; flag respondents otherwise.

root_causes: Missing entry condition: the expected logic shows this item should only be shown in test mode (isTest()), but the SPSS script does not restrict checks to test-mode respondents.

EU membership check implemented by hard-coded qCountry values: the expected PrecodeMask uses isEU() to decide whether codes 2 and 3 are allowed. The script uses a specific qCountry list (7,12,16,10,2057) which may not match the intended isEU() definition.
instructions: Apply the entry condition: limit validation to test-mode respondents. For example, include isTest() in the sel if logic or otherwise ensure the check only runs when isTest() is true.

Use the same EU-determination method as the spec (isEU()) or confirm and document the exact qCountry codes that represent EU membership. If using qCountry codes, verify the list is complete/correct; otherwise, replace the hard-coded list with an isEU() check or correct mapping.

Continue to enforce allowed numeric values (1-5) and flag presence of disallowed codes (e.g., 2 or 3) for non-EU respondents. Explicitly document handling of special codes (97/98/99) if they are intended to be allowed; if not intended, remove them from the allowed set.
